sections.title: Information and Instructions to the User

subsections.title: Manufacturer Identification Details
subsections.description:
This section requires providing the manufacturer’s complete identification details. It must include the official name, registered trade name or trademark, and full contact information such as postal address, email or other digital contact, and—where available—the manufacturer’s website.
These details ensure that users and market operators can clearly identify and contact the manufacturer when needed.

questions.title: Registered Name or Trademark
questions.content: Does the "Manufacturer Identification Details" contain your name, registered trade name or registered trademark?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: SmartHome Tech BV
Reference: Annex II, 1 CRA

questions.title: Postal Address
questions.content: Does the "Manufacturer Identification Details" contain your postal address?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Rue de l’Innovation 12, 1000 Brussels (BE)
Reference: Annex II, 1 CRA

questions.title: Digital Contact
questions.content: Does the "Manufacturer Identification Details" contain your email address or other digital contact?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: support@smarthometech.eu
Reference: Annex II, 1 CRA

questions.title: Website Contact Point
questions.content: Does the "Manufacturer Identifacation Details" contain the website at which you can be contacted (if any)?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: www.smarthometech.be
Reference: Annex II, 1 CRA

subsections.title: Product Identification Information
subsections.description:
This section requires specifying the name, type, and any additional details necessary to uniquely identify the product with digital elements.
Such information ensures that the exact model, version, or variant of the product can be unmistakably distinguished from others in the manufacturer’s portfolio or on the market.

questions.title: Product Name
questions.content: Does the "Product Identification Information" contain the product name?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: SmartSensor S2
Reference: Annex II, 3 CRA

questions.title: Product Type
questions.content: Does the "Product Identification Information" contain the product type?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Smart Sensor
Reference: Annex II, 3 CRA

questions.title: Additional Identification Info
questions.content: Does the "Product Identification Information" contain any additional information enabling unique identification of the PDE?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Released in 2025
Reference: Annex II, 3 CRA

questions.title: Unique Identifier of the PDE
questions.content: Does the "product Identification Information" contain the unique identifier of the PDE?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: SS2-EU-2025-001
Reference: Annex II, 3 CRA

subsections.title: Placement of Product Identification Markings
subsections.description: Manufacturers must ensure that each product with digital elements includes a type, batch, serial number, or any other element that allows for its clear identification. If such marking cannot be placed directly on the product, the information must instead be provided on the packaging or in accompanying documentation. This ensures reliable traceability of each product version placed on the market.

questions.title: Location of Identifiers
questions.content: Have you determined and included, in the "Placement of Product Identification Markings", where can the user find these unique identifiers on the physical product?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: The serial number is located on a label on the back of the device
Reference: Article 13 (15) CRA ( was wrong on the deliverable)

questions.title: Physical Marking on Each Unit
questions.content: Have you determined, regarding "Placement of Product Identification", the marking will you apply to each individual PDE unit to make it uniquely identifiable?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Serial number, QR code, barcode
Reference: Annex 13 (15)

subsections.title: Single Point of Contact
subsections.description: Manufacturers must provide a clearly defined point of contact where users, researchers, and authorities can report vulnerabilities and receive related information, as well as access the manufacturer’s coordinated vulnerability disclosure (CVD) policy.

questions.title: Single Point of Contact (SPOC)
questions.content: Have you determined and included, in "Single Point of Contact", what is your single point of contact?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Report vulnerabilities to security@smarthometech.eu. CVD policy: www.smarthometech.be/security
Reference: Annex II, 2 CRA

subsections.title: Intended Purpose & Security Characteristics
subsections.description: This section specifies the intended purpose/applications of the product with digital elements, including the security environment established by the manufacturer. It must also outline the product’s essential functionalities and describe its key security properties, ensuring users and authorities understand the product’s capabilities and expected secure operating conditions.

questions.title: Primary Functions & Features
questions.content: Does the "Intended Purpose & Security Characteristics" contain which are the primary functions and features of the PDE?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: SmartSensor S2 measures temperature and humidity transmitting data via Wi-Fi to the manufacturer’s cloud
Reference: Annex II, 4 CRA

questions.title: Security-Relevant Features
questions.content: Does the "Intended Purpose & Security Characteristics" which are the security-relevant features?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Encrypted communications (TLS1.3), device authentication, automatic firmware upgrades
Reference: Annex II, 4 CRA

questions.title: Intended Applications of the PDE
questions.content: Does the "Intended Purpose & Security Characteristics" contain which are the intended applications of the PDE?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Detect changes in climatological environment at home.
Example: Available in the user manual and quick start guide.
Reference: Annex II, 4 CRA

questions.title: Security Environment Provided
questions.content: Does the "Intended Purpose & Security Characteristics" contain what is the security environment you provide in which this PDE operates?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info: Reference: Annex II, 4 CRA

questions.title: Target Environment
questions.content: Does the "Intended Purpose & Security Characteristics" contain what is the target environment for this PDE?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Home environment only.
Reference: Annex II, 4 CRA

questions.title: Target Users
questions.content: Does the "Intended Purpose & Security Characteristics" contain who are target users of this PDE?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Consumer device / professional use.
Reference: Annex II, 4 CRA

subsections.title: Foreseeable Conditions Leading to Cybersecurity Risks
subsections.description: Manufacturers must identify any known or reasonably foreseeable circumstances—whether arising during intended use or foreseeable misuse—that could result in significant cybersecurity risks. This ensures that potential risk scenarios are documented and considered during design, development, and user communication.

questions.title: Foreseeable Circumstances Leading to Cybersecurity Risks
questions.content: Does the "Foreseeable Conditions Leading to Cybersecurity Risks" include what are known or foreseeable circumstances which may lead to significant cybersecurity risks?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Using the product without changing the default password may expose it to unauthorised access.
Reference: Annex II, 5 CRA

subsections.title: Access to the EU Declaration of Conformity
subsections.description: Where applicable, manufacturers must provide the internet address where the product’s EU Declaration of Conformity can be accessed. This ensures users and authorities can easily obtain the official compliance documentation in a reliable and accessible manner.

questions.title: DoC Internet Address
questions.content: Does the "Access to the EU Declaration of Conformity" contain what is the internet address at which the EU declaration of conformity can be accessed?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: www.smarthometech.eu/DoC/SS2
Reference: Annex II, 6 CRA

subsections.title: Technical Security Support & Support Period
subsections.description: Manufacturers must specify the type of technical security support they provide—such as vulnerability handling, security patches, or update delivery—along with the end-date of the support period during which users can expect these security updates and vulnerability responses. This ensures transparency about how long the product will remain supported and secure

questions.title: Technical Support Offered
questions.content: Does the "Technical Security Support & Support Period" contain the type of technical support is offered by the manufacturer?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Security updates, Service Desk Delivery (24/7)
Reference: Annex II, 7 CRA

questions.title: End Date of Support Period
questions.content: Does the "Technical Security Support & Support Period" contain what is the end date of the support period?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Security updates provided automatically until 31 Dec 2030 via the SmartHome app.
Reference: Annex II, 7 CRA

questions.title: Location of Detailed Security Instructions
questions.content: Does the "Technical Security Support & Support Period" contain where can users find detailed security instructions?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Provided with the PDE, and available online on www.smarthometech.be/DetailedInstructions/SS2
Reference: Annex II, 8 CRA

subsections.title: Detailed User Instructions & Security Guidance

questions.title: Initial Setup Security Measures
questions.content: Does the "Detailed User Instructions & Security Guidance" contain what measures must users take during the initial setup to ensure the product is used securely?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Change default password; connect only to trusted Wi-Fi networks.
Reference: Annex II, 8(a) CRA

questions.title: Security Configurations / Default Settings
questions.content: Does the "Detailed User Instructions & Security Guidance" contain what security configurations or default settings are applied by the manufacturer at first use?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Automatic updates enabled; firewall on by default.
Reference: Derived from Annex II, 8(a) CRA

questions.title: User Actions Needed for Lifetime Security
questions.content: Does the "Detailed User Instructions & Security Guidance" contain what user actions are needed over the product’s lifetime to keep it secure?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Install firmware updates, review access permissions regularly, follow recommended actions shown by the product, it is recommended to allow automatic security updates.
Reference: Annex II, 8(a) CRA

questions.title: Automatic Installation of Security Updates
questions.content: Is automatic installation of security updates enabled by default?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Yes
Reference: Annex II, 8(c) CRA

questions.title: Disabling Automatic Security Updates
questions.content: Does the "Detailed User Instructions & Security Guidance" contain how can automatic installation of security updates be turned off?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Settings > Updates > Advanced Options > Toggle off automatic updates
Reference: Annex II, 8(c) CRA

questions.title: Changes Affecting Cybersecurity
questions.content: Does the "Detailed User Instructions & Security Guidance" contain what types of changes or modifications (software, hardware, configuration) could affect the product’s cybersecurity?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Installing third-party apps, sideloading apps, replacing the default operating system
Reference: Annex II, 8(b) CRA

questions.title: Notification of Security-Relevant Changes
questions.content: Have you determined and included, regarding "Detailed User Instructions to the User", how are users or integrators should be informed that a change could affect data or system security?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Release notes, warning prompts before updates
Reference: Annex II, 8(f) CRA

questions.title: Checking Security Status After Changes
questions.content: Does the "Detailed User Instructions & Security Guidance" contain how can users check the security status of the product after a change?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Version info in settings; security dashboard at www.smarthometech.be/security
Reference: Annex II, 8(f) CRA

questions.title: Installing Security-Relevant Updates
questions.content: Does the "Detailed User Instructions & Security Guidance" contain how can users install security-relevant updates?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Automatic over-the-air (OTA) updates; manual download option
Reference: Annex II, 8(c) CRA

questions.title: Verifying Successful Update Installation
questions.content: Does the "Detailed User Instructions & Security Guidance" contain what steps must users follow to confirm successful installation of security updates?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Check version number after installation in settings
Reference: Annex II, 8(c) CRA

questions.title: Secure Decommissioning or Disposal
questions.content: Does the "Detailed User Instructions & Security Guidance" contain how can users securely decommission or dispose of a product?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Perform a factory reset (Settings > System > Recovery > Reset to factory settings)
Reference: Annex II, 8(d) CRA

questions.title: Secure Data Deletion Before Disposal
questions.content: Does the "Detailed User Instructions & Security Guidance" contain how can users delete their data before disposal?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Use a companion app for data wipe
Reference: Annex II, 8(d) CRA

questions.title: Information for Integrators
questions.content: Does the "Detailed User Instructions & Security Guidance" contain what information do integrators need to ensure continued cybersecurity?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: API authentication method, patch policy
Reference: Annex II, 8(f) CRA

questions.title: Documentation for Integrators
questions.content: Does the "Detailed User Instructions & Security Guidance" contain what documentation do you provide to integrators?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Integration manual
Reference: Annex II, 8(f) CRA

questions.title: Security Implications for Integration
questions.content: Does the "Detailed User Instructions & Security Guidance" contain what are the security implications (if any) specific to integrating the PDE into another system?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.info:
Example: Integrated Smart Sensor will rely on network encryption and authentication settings
Reference: Annex II, 8(f) CRA; Deliverable 2.5
